description: This informative notification is sent from the Active node when it
notices a peer node rejoin the cluster. It is sent only once.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaNodeJoined VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPrivateAddressType i 0 VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPrivateAddressAddr s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaTargetNodeRole i 1

description: A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: The type of cluster network interface: ipv4 or ipv6.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPrivateAddressType

description: This is the IP address of each node in cluster network that is used to
communicate with other nodes in the cluster and transfer data between
the Active node and the Passive node.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPrivateAddressAddr

description: Represents the role of node being affected by the given event. See MIB
module general description for detailed expalanation for each role.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaTargetNodeRole

description: This warning notification is sent from the Active node when it notices
a peer node has left the cluster. This is sent only once. Operator
should check the liveness and connectivity of the departed node and try
to bring it back by either rebooting the appliance or resolving the
network problem.

event.Summary: Peer node $v3 left the cluster; Node Role: $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaNodeLeft VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPrivateAddressType i 0 VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPrivateAddressAddr s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaTargetNodeRole i 1

description: A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: The type of cluster network interface: ipv4 or ipv6.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPrivateAddressType

description: This is the IP address of each node in cluster network that is used to
communicate with other nodes in the cluster and transfer data between
the Active node and the Passive node.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPrivateAddressAddr

description: Represents the role of node being affected by the given event. See MIB
module general description for detailed expalanation for each role.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaTargetNodeRole

description: This warning notification is sent when a node is network isolated from
the cluster. This notification can only be sent from the isolated node
not by other nodes in the cluster. After being isolated, the node will
reboot itself trigging coldStart notification. In case of Active node
failure, the cluster will trigger a reelection and every slave node will
be declared as isolated temporarily before the cluster re-election
completes.

event.Summary: vCenter HA Node $v3 isolated from the cluster; Node Role: $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaNodeIsolated VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPrivateAddressType i 0 VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPrivateAddressAddr s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaTargetNodeRole i 1

description: A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: The type of cluster network interface: ipv4 or ipv6.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPrivateAddressType

description: This is the IP address of each node in cluster network that is used to
communicate with other nodes in the cluster and transfer data between
the Active node and the Passive node.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPrivateAddressAddr

description: Represents the role of node being affected by the given event. See MIB
module general description for detailed expalanation for each role.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaTargetNodeRole

description: This notification is sent only once from the Active node when vCenter
HA cluster state changes to either healthy, degraded or isolated. Please
see VmwVchaClusterStateType for detailed description of each state. And
administrator should receive another notification describing the state
change of cluster subsystem (cluster membership, DB replication or file
replication) which is trigger of cluster state change.
A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: vCenter HA cluster states: healthy, degraded or isolated.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaClusterState

description: This notification is sent only once from the Active node when vCenter
HA cluster mode changes to either enabled, maintenance or disabled.
A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: vCenter HA cluster modes: enabled, maintenance or disabled.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaClusterMode

description: This informative notification is sent only once when the public IP
address is brought up on the Active node. At this time, the Active node
is reachable from the client and will be able to serve client requests
when services are up and running.

event.Summary: vCenter HA public IP $v3 is up

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPublicIpUp VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPublicAddressType i 0 VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPublicAddressAddr s EXAMPLE

description: A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: The type of public network interface: ipv4 or ipv6.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPublicAddressType

description: The IP address of a node in public network that serves client's request.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPublicAddressAddr

description: This informative notification is sent only once when the public
network interface is brought down on the Active node. This can happen
when InitiateFailover is invoked on the Active node or vcha process
gracefully shuts down resulting in a reboot of the appliance (triggered
by network isolation). During this time, clients cannot connect to
vCenter Server and users will experience downtime until the public
network interface is brought up. In either case, users should not
expect more than five minutes of downtime. If VCHA cluster is still not
connectable, the operator should verify the reachability of each node
through the cluster network.

event.Summary: vCenter HA public network IP $v3 is down

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPublicIpDown VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPublicAddressType i 0 VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPublicAddressAddr s EXAMPLE

description: A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: The type of public network interface: ipv4 or ipv6.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPublicAddressType

description: The IP address of a node in public network that serves client's request.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaPublicAddressAddr

description: This informative notification is sent only once when a failover is
triggered from the Active node to Passive node. Passive node should
take over the Active role if the cluster is in healthy state.

event.Summary: vCenter HA failover triggered from active node to passive node

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaFailoverTriggered VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaIsPlannedFailover i 1

description: A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: For planned failover, the Active node flushes all the state to the Passive
node, waits for the flush to complete before causing a failover.
After the failover, the Passive node starts without any data loss.
For unplanned failover, the failover is initiated immediately and may
result in data loss.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaIsPlannedFailover

description: This informative notification is sent only once when the Passive node
takes over the Active role and brings up the public network interface.

event.Summary: Passive node successfully took the active role

description: A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: This warning notification is sent only once when the Active node fails
to initiate a failover because the cluster is in disabled mode.

event.Summary: Active node failed to initiate a faiover because cluster is in disabled mode

description: A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: This warning notification is sent only once when the Active node fails
to initiate a failover because the cluster does not have all three
nodes connected.

event.Summary: Active node failed to initiate a failover because cluster nodes are disconnected

description: A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: This warning notification is sent only once when the Active node fails
to initiate a failover because vPostgres service on the Passive node is
not ready to take over.

event.Summary: Active node failed to initiate a failover because vPostgres service on passive node is not ready

description: A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: This informative notification is sent only once when the last Active
node continue as the Active node to servce client's request. This can
happen in many scenarios:
1. After triggering a planned failover, DB or file replicator failed to
flush data to the Passive node and failover didn't proceed because of
data loss.
2. After triggering a planned or forced failover, Passive node failed to
pick up the Active role for reasons like: auto failover cannot happen in
maintenance mode or cluster is in disabled mode.

event.Summary: vCenter HA cluster node continues working as Active node

description: A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: This informative notification is sent only once from the Active node
when database replication state changes to sync, async or no
replication. Database replication is not healthy when it is in async or
no replication state. Reasons include large network delays or vPostgres
service becoming unresponsive on the Passive node.
A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: Database replication states: sync, async or no replication.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaDbReplicationState

description: This informative notification is sent only once from the Active node
when file replication state changes to in-sync or out-of-sync. File
replication state is out-of-sync when VCHA fails to set a watch on a
file at the Active node or fails to replicate a file from the Active
node to Passive. Administrators should check the corresponding KB
article for recovery action.

Summary.eval: ($v3==1) ? 'vCenter HA file replication provider state: In-sync' : 'vCenter HA file replication provider state: Out-of-sync'

description: A string that uniquely identify the vCenter HA cluster. This is the same
as instance UUID of the active vCenter Server.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaInstanceUuid

description: File replication providers: service-config or service-state.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaFileReplicationProvider

description: This variable represents the file replication provider state. When it is
false, the service configuration and state files are out of sync between
the Passive and Active nodes. This could result from file replication
failures.
variables.name: VMWARE-VCHA-MIB::vmwVchaIsFileProviderInSync
